title: Coinpaper.com
author: Coinpaper.com
content: Hello,We've just published a new subpage containing all Cryptocurrency logosYou can find all cryptocurrency logos there including Bitcoin, BCH and Bitcoin SV.You can also use form to inquire about adding new logos to the database.https://coinpaper.com/logos

comments.author: BenCodie
comments.body: You've done well to create this resource, a similar one already exists at CryptoLogos.cc however. If you want your resource to be chosen over others, I would recommend adding some points of difference and becoming a little more active in the forum, and/or create some discussion as to how you can make your resource more useful for people in comparison to other ones like Cryptologos.cc.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: BenCodie on April 11, 2023, 02:40:39 PMYou've done well to create this resource, a similar one already exists at CryptoLogos.cc however. If you want your resource to be chosen over others, I would recommend adding some points of difference and becoming a little more active in the forum, and/or create some discussion as to how you can make your resource more useful for people in comparison to other ones like Cryptologos.cc. It's not a logo-dedicated platform it's an article-based platform this is their homepage https://coinpaper.com/ They just added it as an additional resource to make their site a good resource but I just wonder why OP did not create a menu for visibility how would first-time visitors know that they have a page dedicated for Crypto logos when that page is not in their menu.

comments.author: Ndabagi01
comments.body: Quote from: coin-investor on April 11, 2023, 03:05:35 PMIt's not a logo-dedicated platform it's an article-based platform this is their homepage https://coinpaper.com/ They just added it as an additional resource to make their site a good resource but I just wonder why OP did not create a menu for visibility how would first-time visitors know that they have a page dedicated for Crypto logos when that page is not in their menu.I had no idea it was an article-based website until I clicked on the link you provided. The OP must be new to this and has simply written here to get feedback from others on it. Or he undertakes separate work from the remaining team members which makes him not to connect the main website to the one dedicated to logos exclusively. If he does not explicitly explain the website and other services they offer at the same time, he may simply be a passerby who feels compelled to post here. He's only searching for criticism, but he should have done better than this one post only.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: Coinpaper.com on April 11, 2023, 01:07:25 PMYou can also use form to inquire about adding new logos to the database.Why do we need to login in g00gle just to post form for new logos?I appreciate your work but if you could please find some alternative way of submitting suggestions with the need to log in or use g00gle.I was thinking of sending old Bitcoin logos that were made before current version, this could be named as old_bitcoin_logo or put in archive category.Quote from: Coinpaper.com on April 11, 2023, 01:07:25 PMand Bitcoin SV.Adding shitcoin logo for this crap would be perfectÂ  Something like this:https://coinmarketcrap.co/

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: The idea is beautiful, I liked it, but can you add more details, such as the historical development of the design, where was the first time the design was mentioned and the subsequent stages, and add a story about the logo if possible, meaning the reason for choosing this logo.The first logo of Bitcoin was not the current one, but rather this, and if you search in the forum, you will find its story.
